Posts.Content: armywifenmommy wrote: hello.    this is my first go at a discussion board.  i am searching for answers to questions that i am hoping that one of you has... i had a bilateral mastectomy on 9/30 and began reconstruction with expanders during that surgery.  all seemed to go well.  i was not sure how i was supposed to be feeling and seemed to be having a more difficult time getting back on my feet than i had anticipated.  come to find out i had an infection in the left side.  i was put back in the hospital on iv antibiotics and then sent home on oral antibiotics.  still wasn't feeling up to par.  i ended up in the er bleeding out of the wound on the left side and pretty infected...stil.  i was hospitalized again and then late one night the decision was made to go to surgery.  they were going to see if they could save the expander, they could not.  i was devestated.  but - i felt so much better physically.  during my first hospital stay - my husband returned back oversees.   it has been rough emotionally and i am seen at a military treatment facility.  i am having trouble sleeping and am wondering if that is common.  also i am wondering what the normal timeframe is for attempting to begin reconstruction again.  i don't get to see my husband that often and he hasn't seen the left side as torn up as it is.  i would rather he didn't.  today is my first day back at work - i work a desk job - it feels good to be moving forward - but it is exhausting.  does it take long to get back into the swing of things? any ideas? thanks!
